main.name: Hello, I'm Albert!
main.description: Aspiring to work on software engineering projects - with a lot of MATH!
main.bio1: I love programming, I love math, I love physics <3 I just love problem-solving in general, especially if it involves a lot of coding! My dream job is to work on software development projects where I can learn, ideate and implement exciting solutions!
main.bio2: Aside from that, I am an extra-outgoing guy who loves conversations and anything public speaking. And, to keep myself sane (from all the coding), I love to gym and watch anime (Warning: I am a JoJo fan).
main.contactmessage: Contact me to collaborate on software development projects!

resume.skillmessage: Here you can create a short write-up of your skills to show off to employers

education.degree: B. Comp in Computer Science and Mathematics
education.description2: Recipient of NUS Undergraduate Merit Scholarship (ASEAN)

education.description: Raffles Academy (Olympiad Training) in Physics and Mathematics
education.description3: Recipient of Raffles Institution School-Based Full Scholarship (ASEAN)

work.title: Software Developer Intern
work.description: My internship at ConcreteAI was a blast! I learned a wide variety of technical software engineering skills: low-level development in C++, mobile application development using Kotlin (Android studio) and time series classfication with PyTorch MLP models. My main takeaways are: reading documentation skills (Actually! This helps me pick new concepts much faster with regards to new libraries or frameworks) and writing code responsibly -  and readable code :)

work.title: Co-Founder
work.description: I started an e-commerce start-up offering premium fashion items made in Indonesia in a team of three, collaborating with 15+ renowned brands with 200+ total products. In this journey, I contributed by developing the website using WixSite and worked on my professional communication abilities. Although CARAKA came to an end, regret was the furthest thing that came to my mind due to the skills and work experience I gained and the contribution we made to society with our community involvement project during my time building this startup.

work.title: Teaching Assistant
work.description: I teach CS1010E Introduction to Programming in Python to a class of 25 freshmen. I learned how to explain programming concepts in an easy-to-understand way for those without programming background. This helped me enhance my communication ability to non-IT personnels and deepen my understanding of programming concepts.

work.title: Residential Assistant
work.description: RI Boarding is the first family I made in Singapore. I feel a strong sense of belonging to this community which is why I returned as a residential assisstant. I handle administrative work and contribute to the community by providing basic web-development crash course on my free time.

skills.name: Programming Language
skills.description: C, C++, Java, JavaScript, HTML, CSS, Python, Kotlin

skills.name: Framework and Tools
skills.description: React, Kotlin (Android Studio), NodeJS, ExpressJS, Firebase, MongoDB, Git

project.name: FoodSense
project.title: Full-Stack Software Developer
project.description: To further improve my software development skills, I worked in a team of two to build a restaurant analytics website as the sole software developer. This project is where the concept of software development really clicked for the first time for me as I learned to build the website's backend and frontend from scratch. You can check the live website @

activity.name: NUS Indonesian Association
activity.title: Head of Tech. Division
activity.description: I am leading a team of eight programmers to work on a year-long software development project (Soon!). I will update as the project progresses!

activity.name: Young Physicists’ Tournament
activity.title: Physics Researcher
activity.description: I investigated an optics phenomenon named "The Drifting Speckle" where I coded simulation using C++ and Wolfram Mathematics based on Fourier Physics and Matrix Algebra and built experimental set-up to verify my simulation's theoretical predicitons. I received a Silver Medal in Singapore Young Physicists’ Tournament Category A 2020.

activity.name: Robotics Competitions
activity.title: Robotics Engineer
activity.description: I built robots using Lego and Arduino componets and programmed them using Python and Arduino C. I achieved 3rd Place Award in Singapore Robocup Open 2019 and Best Programming Award in National Robotics Competition 2019.

activity.name: Physics Olympiad
activity.title: Medallist
activity.description: I won Silver Medal in Singapore Physics Olympiad 2019, Bronze and Silver Medals in Singapore Junior Physics Olympiad 2017 and 2018

volunteering.name: CARAKA X Veteran Indonesia Fundraiser
volunteering.title: Organizer
volunteering.description: I partnered with Veteran Indonesia to raise S$2000 to alleviate financial adversities encountered by veterans during Covid-19 pandemic. I gathered and led 300+ volunteers to deploy social media platforms to raise funds. I also utilized this project to promote opening-sales of Caraka, thereby reducing advertising expenditure.

volunteering.name: Project 001
volunteering.title: Organizer
volunteering.description: I Initiated a volunteering project aiming to expose basic programming knowledge to underprivileged primary school children in Singapore. Here, I collaborated withAng Mo Kio CDC to find beneficiaries as well as gathered and led 50 volunteers from Raffles Institutions.
